title: Bierock Casserole Recipe
description: This delicious bierock casserole recipe combines a ground beef and sauerkraut mixture that is baked between two layers of crescent roll dough.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Bierock Casserole 4.1 (224) 181 Reviews 10 Photos A savory bierock casserole with a ground beef and sauerkraut mixture baked between two layers of crescent roll dough, in the style of bierock pastries. This is almost as good as the orginal bierock, but is a lot less time consuming! Submitted by Kathy Wing Updated on January 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ½ cup chopped onion 1 ½ pounds lean ground beef 1 (16 ounce) can sauerkraut, drained and pressed dry 2 (8 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent rolls 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brown onion and ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain extra fat out of skillet, then stir in drained sauerkraut. Heat through and set aside. Press 1 package of crescent roll dough into the bottom of a lightly greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Spread beef mixture on top, then lay 2nd package of crescent roll dough over the top of beef mixture. Press dough seams together and sprinkle all with cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown. Add Your Photo Photos of Bierock Casserole 01 of 10 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 10 Photo by  Cheryl Jacobson 04/17/2020 This was a swing and a miss for me. I followed the recipe as posted, adding flour and water as a binder. I love Sauerkraut, but it was bland even after spicing the meat generously. it lacked the brightness of the Sauerkraut I was looking for. The flavors melded together having a "non-taste" taste. I gave it 3 stars because my fiance really enjoyed it. I'll keep it in my back pocket for him. Thanks for the recipe Kathy! 03 of 10 Photo by  Brandi Henks 10/26/2015 04 of 10 Photo by  ©@s§¡€ 09/04/2015 I remember watching my mother make bierocks years ago. I also remember how long it took her and how grouchy she got! But they were delicious!!! I wouldn't say a casserole can beat the traditional bierock, but oh my sanity thanks me for sure. I did alter this recipe by adding a can of cream of mushroom soup and cabbage... OF COURSE! I steamed the cabbage with a chopped onion for 10 minutes while I mixed the sauerkraut, browned/drained hamburger w/ another sauteed onion, cream of mushroom, cheddar cheese and salt and pepper. Topped the bottom layer of crescent roll with cabbage, sauerkraut and beef mixture. Then topped w/ crescent roll sheet which I topped that with more shredded cheese. Baked about 20 minutes @350 and pastry was golden brown. Kids all loved! Sauerkraut. Onion and ALL! 05 of 10 Photo by  nico110178 06/12/2015 06 of 10 Photo by  Penny 03/20/2015 07 of 10 Photo by  tbryant127 10/09/2011 08 of 10 Photo by  tothetelly 08/07/2011 09 of 10 Photo by  Die Hummel 08/25/2008 10 of 10 Photo by  GINNIMCCOY 09/27/2006 1 You’ll Also Love Cheddar Bratzenkraut 2 Ratings Kraut Bierocks 152 Ratings Grandma Elaine's Unstuffed Cabbage Rolls 93 Ratings Krautburger 77 Ratings Green Bean Tater Tot Casserole 233 Ratings Sausage 'n Kraut 13 Ratings German Spaghettini 19 Ratings Golompke (Beef and Cabbage Casserole) 64 Ratings Sausage and Sauerkraut 291 Ratings Classic Tuna Noodle Casserole 165 Ratings German Beef Rouladen 151 Ratings Easy Enchiladas 84 Ratings Spanish Rice Bake 1,459 Ratings Chili Dog Casserole 642 Ratings The Best Spaghetti Casserole 190 Ratings Beef Bourguignon II 636 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Kathy Wing
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Brown onion and ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain extra fat out of skillet, then stir in drained sauerkraut. Heat through and set aside.;Press 1 package of crescent roll dough into the bottom of a lightly greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Spread beef mixture on top, then lay 2nd package of crescent roll dough over the top of beef mixture. Press dough seams together and sprinkle all with cheese.;Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
